basic.description:
The focus is on aspects of cardiovascular and respiratory adjustments related to exercise, and effects of exercise training on these adjustments. Special topics include: Limitations to muscle aerobic metabolic adaptation, impact of select cardiovascular and respiratory diseases, and performance enhancement in endurance sports.
NOTE    This course will normally be offered in academic years starting with an odd number (e.g., 2013-2014). Students in a KINE Plan will have priority over students in a PHED Plan.
RECOMMENDATION    KNPE 225/3.0 or KINE 225/3.0.
basic.subject: KNPE
basic.title: Cardiovascular and Respiratory Control in Exercise

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Recommendation    KNPE225 or KINE225
Prerequisites    Level 3 or above in a PHED or KINE Specialization Plan and KNPE125, KNPE227 and KNPE255.
